summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting the voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Captain (formerly an Administrative Lieutenant at MCC New York) regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview focused on training procedures for correctional officers at MCC New York during Epstein's incarceration in July and August 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death in custody is the subject of the OIG investigation. He was housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in July and August 2019.

persons.name: Captain
persons.role: Administrative Lieutenant at MCC New York (at time of events), Captain at FCI Fort Dix (at time of interview)
persons.context: A BOP officer interviewed by the OIG regarding training procedures for correctional officers at MCC New York during the period Jeffrey Epstein was housed there.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Conducted the voluntary interview of the BOP Captain on October 27, 2021, as part of the OIG investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Senior Special Agent
persons.context: Conducted the voluntary interview of the BOP Captain on October 27, 2021, alongside the Special Agent.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: OIG Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Reviewed the prepared memorandum of the interview.

connections.description: The Captain, as Administrative Lieutenant at MCC New York, was responsible for ensuring correctional officers received required training while Epstein was an inmate there.
The OIG Special Agent interviewed the BOP Captain as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.
The OIG Senior Special Agent interviewed the BOP Captain alongside the Special Agent.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: Special Agent and Senior Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of a BOP Captain regarding training procedures at MCC New York during Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

events.title: Epstein Housed at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York.

events.title: Epstein Housed at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York.

locations: New York Field Office, New York, New York (location of OIG interview)
Federal Correctional Institution (FCI) Fort Dix, New Jersey (current assignment of interviewed Captain)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York (where Jeffrey Epstein was housed)
keyFacts: The document is part of an official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A key focus of the investigation is the training provided to correctional officers at MCC New York during Epstein's incarceration in July and August 2019.
The interviewed BOP Captain was the Administrative Lieutenant at MCC New York at that time and was responsible for ensuring officers received required training.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the memorandum includes attachments such as training sign-in sheets and PowerPoint slides related to suicide prevention.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum containing neither recommendations nor conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
